info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 2:38PM PDT until October 12 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY... At 238 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicates thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area have decreased in intensity. However, between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain has fallen across the warned area and runoff from the earlier storms continues. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yucca Valley, Joshua Tree, Joshua Tree Lake Campground and Morongo Valley, SR-62. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
